message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SY

The paper discusses a novel approach to credit assignment in deep networks, which is a fundamental problem in neural networks and falls under the category of neural networks and learning. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also compares the proposed approach with back-propagation, which is a popular optimization algorithm in machine learning and falls under the category of machine learning and statistics. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the second most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions auto-encoders, which are a type of neural network used for unsupervised learning and fall under the category of artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the third most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions denoising auto-encoders, which are commonly used in computer vision and image processing, falling under the category of computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the fourth most likely sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method that can be applied to networks with stochastic units, which is a topic in control systems and falls under the category of systems and control. Therefore, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is the fifth most likely sub-category.
